Issues.Title: fix(ivy): compiler compliance tests actualized
Issues.Body:
PR #27404 introduced additional test case to make sure we generate `elementStyling` instructions with proper set of arguments (first argument was missing in some cases). It looks like that PR was created before we updated host vars count calculation and the `allocHostVars` becomes unnecessary in the test cases introduced in PR #27404. This commit actualizes this test to get rid of unnecessary `allocHostVars` instruction.

Issues.Title: test(ivy): more precise TestBed failure causes for View/Content Queries (FW-670)
Issues.Body:
This PR is a result of the `Internal Error: The name q is already defined in scope` error message investigation in Queries tests in TestBed. It turned out that the error message is legitimate, i.e. for the particular test case that was triggering this problem the "q" local ref was defined twice: ```
``` while this was allowed and didn't trigger an error in View Engine, in Ivy the definition of local refs in a scope is more strict and refs with the same name are not allowed. This limitation is describe in breaking changes doc and corresponding test cases were added (to `ngtsc_spec.ts`) to verify the behavior. ## PR Type What kind of change does this PR introduce? - [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables) - [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes) - [ ] Build related changes ## Does this PR introduce a breaking change? - [ ] Yes - [x] No This PR identifies/describes a breaking change, but an actual change was introduced previously.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): do not use MSG_ prefix for i18nPostprocess invocation (FW-779)
Issues.Body:
Closure Compiler doesn't allow non-goo.getMsg const names to start with `MSG_`, so we should use different prefix for const that references a result of the `i18nPostprocess` fn invocation.

Also, as a part of this PR, const names received file based prefix to avoid naming collisions that Closure Compiler doesn't tolerate (there should be unique instance of `goog.getMsg` call across the whole app).

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

Issues.Title: It is unclear when looking at the docs whether or not private viewchild is allowed
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

Found here:
https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#phase-2-code-generation
is the statement:
> Decorated component class members must be public. You cannot make an @Input() property private or internal.

But here:
https://angular.io/guide/component-interaction#parent-calls-an-viewchild
is an example of a private @ViewChild

Further more, performing my own checks with '--prod' seems to confirm that it does work just fine.  I would like to be able to make a member private if it's truly only in use internally by the class (obviously still needs to be public if used by the template).

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**

https://angular.io/guide/aot-compiler#phase-2-code-generation
https://angular.io/guide/component-interaction#parent-calls-an-viewchild

### Reproduction Steps**

Create an annotated member like the following:

``` ts
@ViewChild(MyDirective)
private myDirective: MyDirective;
```
And verify that by OnAfterViewInit, there is a valid reference in the private field.

An example is here:

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-vxbpuk?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts

## üåç  Your Environment

Angular 7.03
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "It is unclear when looking at the docs whether or not private viewchild is allowed" (#27467)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): ngtsc shim files not being generated on case-insensitive platforms
Issues.Body:
Common insensitive platforms are `win32/win64` (see: [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/blob/3e4c5c95abd515eb9713b881d27ab3a93cc00461/src/compiler/sys.ts#L681-L682))


Currently when running `bazel build packages/core --define=compile=aot`, the `compiler-cli` will throw because it cannot find the `index.ngfactory.ts` file in the compiler host. This is because the shim host wrapper is not properly generating the requested `ngfactory` file.

```
 Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:/users/paul/_bazel_paul/lm3s4mgv/execroot/angular/packages/core/index.ngfactory.ts'
    at Object.openSync (fs.js:434:3)
    at Object.readFileSync (fs.js:339:35)
    at CachedFileLoader.loadFile (C:\users\paul\_bazel_paul\lm3s4mgv\external\internal\tsc_wrapped\cache.ts:366:29)
    at C:\users\paul\_bazel_paul\lm3s4mgv\external\internal\tsc_wrapped\compiler_host.ts:413:34
    at Object.wrap (C:\users\paul\_bazel_paul\lm3s4mgv\external\internal\tsc_wrapped\perf_trace.ts:54:12)
    at CompilerHost.getSourceFile (C:\users\paul\_bazel_paul\lm3s4mgv\external\internal\tsc_wrapped\compiler_host.ts:412:22)
    at GeneratedShimsHostWrapper.getSourceFile (C:\users\paul\_bazel_paul\lm3s4mgv\execroot\angular\packages\compiler-cli\src\ngtsc\shims\src\host.ts:66:26)

```

This happens because we call `getCanonicalFileName` that returns a path that is different to the actual `rootNames` (passed to `NgtscProgram`) which are used to construct a map of generated files.

Since the generators always use the paths which are not normalized and TypeScript seems to pass "non"-canonical paths to the host `getSourceFile`, we should be able to stop manually calling `getCanonicalFileName` (this would then follow typescript internal semantics apparently)

--- 

Example: 
```js

// Generator Map:

'C:/users/paul/_bazel_paul/lm3s4mgv/execroot/angular/packages/core/index.ngfactory.ts' =>
'C:/users/paul/_bazel_paul/lm3s4mgv/execroot/angular/packages/core/index.ts',

// getSourceFile fileName
C:/users/paul/_bazel_paul/lm3s4mgv/execroot/angular/packages/core/index.ngfactory.ts

// after getCanonicalFileName (notice the lower-case drive name)
c:/users/paul/_bazel_paul/lm3s4mgv/execroot/angular/packages/core/index.ngfactory.ts
```

See [source code of getCanonicalFileName](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/blob/3e4c5c95abd515eb9713b881d27ab3a93cc00461/src/compiler/program.ts#L76-L79).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): ngtsc shim files not being generated on case-insensitive platforms" (#27466)

Issues.Title: ci(docs-infra): manually trigger the preview server webhook
Issues.Body:
With this change, we no longer depend on CircleCI to trigger the webhook (which it sometimes does with considerable delay or not at all).

This has the added benefit that other jobs will not unnecessarily trigger webhooks and spam the preview server logs. It is only the `aio_preview` job's webhook that we care about.

Related to #27352.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci(docs-infra): manually trigger the preview server webhook" (#27458)

This option means guards and resolvers will ignore changes to matrix parameters. Guards and resolvers will be rerun when the path changes, when path parameters change, or when query parameters change.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): deduplicate directives in component scopes
Issues.Body:
A previous fix to ngtsc opened the door for duplicate directives in
the 'directives' array of a component. This would happen if the directive
was declared in a module which was imported more than once within the
component's module.

This commit adds deduplication when the component's scope is materialized,
so declarations which arrive via more than one module import are coalesced.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): deduplicate directives in component scopes" (#27462)

Issues.Title: ngtsc/ngcc: unable to statically resolve UMD references
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/compiler-cli

### Description

In UMD packages we get directive declarations such as 

```
{selector: 'cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport',
    template: "...",
    styles: ["..."],
    host: { ... },
    encapsulation: core.ViewEncapsulation.None,
    changeDetection: core.ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
}
```

Note that there are expressions like `core.ViewEncapsulation.None`. The `core` identifier refers to the parameter on the factory function, which is effectively a namespace for an import. The wrapper and function declaration looks like:

```
"(function (global, factory) {
	typeof exports === 'object' && typeof module !== 'undefined' ? factory(exports, require('@angular/core'), require('@angular/cdk/coercion'), require('rxjs'), require('rxjs/operators'), require('@angular/cdk/platform'), require('@angular/cdk/bidi'), require('@angular/cdk/collections')) :
	typeof define === 'function' && define.amd ? define('@angular/cdk/scrolling', ['exports', '@angular/core', '@angular/cdk/coercion', 'rxjs', 'rxjs/operators', '@angular/cdk/platform', '@angular/cdk/bidi', '@angular/cdk/collections'], factory) :
	(factory((global.ng = global.ng || {}, global.ng.cdk = global.ng.cdk || {}, global.ng.cdk.scrolling = {}),global.ng.core,global.ng.cdk.coercion,global.rxjs,global.rxjs.operators,global.ng.cdk.platform,global.ng.cdk.bidi,global.ng.cdk.collections));
}(this, (function (exports,core,coercion,rxjs,operators,platform,bidi,collections) { 'use strict';
```

where the factory function that declares `core` as a parameter is `function (exports,core,coercion,rxjs,operators,platform,bidi,collections) { ... }`.

When ngcc tries to compile this file, it tries to statically resolve `core.ViewEncapsulation.None` and then fails because it cannot resolve the `core` (`Parameter`) node.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

The error can be seen in the integration test for the ngcc UMD support PR (https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/25445). See https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/119366.

## üî• Exception or Error

```
Compiling @angular/cdk/scrolling - umd
Error: Don't know how to refer to Parameter
    at StaticInterpreter.getReference (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:635:23)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitDeclaration (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:420:29)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitIdentifier (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:394:31)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitExpression (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:275:29)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitPropertyAccessExpression (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:465:28)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitExpression (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:278:29)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitPropertyAccessExpression (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:465:28)
    at StaticInterpreter.visitExpression (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:278:29)
    at StaticInterpreter.visit (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:250:25)
    at Object.staticallyResolve (angular/integration/ngcc/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/metadata/src/resolver.js:208:53)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngtsc/ngcc: unable to statically resolve UMD references" (#27452)

Issues.Title: Angular Router - routerLinkActive ignores fragments
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? I can not say. I've first tried implementing it in 7.0.* where the behaviour was the same. ### Description The goal is a navigation with anchor links which are highlighted as active whenever the route points to the link's (complete) url (e.g. _/foo/bar#one_). The issue manifests itself when working with _routerLink_, _routerLinkActive_, _routerLinkActiveOptions_, and _fragment_. When setting _routerLinkActiveOptions_ to `{exact: true}`, according to [the documentation](https://angular.io/api/router/RouterLinkActive#routerLinkActiveOptions), the router is expected to set the _routerLink_ as active only if the url matches exactly. By my assumption this includes parameters and anchor tags as well - otherwise it would not make much sense to set `[routerLinkActiveOptions]="{exact: true}"` at all. However, this is not the case, as every link that points to the same (routerLink) url is set as active. While researching the issue I found a [PR](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/27108) that targets a similar behaviour with url parameters (related to [#19399](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/19399) and [#20698](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20698)). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [‚Üí StackBlitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/dvl-ng-router-anchorscrolling) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
"@angular/compiler": "^7.1.1",
"@angular/core": "^7.1.1",
"@angular/common": "^7.1.1",
"@angular/router": "^7.1.1",
[‚Üí Link to package.json](https://stackblitz.com/edit/dvl-ng-router-anchorscrolling?file=package.json) **Anything else relevant?** The behaviour persists in the following browsers (all that I tested): Windows 10: - Chrome 70 - Firefox 63 - Edge 42 - IE 11 Mac OS Mojave: - Safari 12 - Chrome 70 - Firefox 63
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Router - routerLinkActive ignores fragments" (#27450)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): fix #12886, import zone related flags in other file.
Issues.Body:
fix #12886.

all zone related `flags` now in `polyfills.ts`, which will not work properly, because `webpack` will put `import 'zone.js/dist/zone'` before `setting those flags`, which will make those `flags useless`.

So in this PR, I created a standalone file `zone-flags.ts` to keep the `import` in correct order.

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): code coverage for ng build, ng serve and ng e2e
Issues.Body:
This PR is related to #6286 and allows `--code-coverage` and `--code-coverage-exclude` options to be used with `ng build`, `ng serve` and `ng e2e`, so that it is easy to instrument the code for coverage.

When used with these commands, the `--code-coverage` switch does not automatically create a file with the report but allows the developers to access the `__coverage__` variable from Istanbul.js inside the browser to get coverage data.
That object can then be used to generate a report as described in https://istanbul.js.org/docs/advanced/coverage-object-report/

Issues.Title: Enable fine grain optimization settings
Issues.Body:
While doing the sourceMaps and optimisations flags, there were several places that had duplicate logic, and options were not really type safety as in most cases a castings was used.

This tried to improve how we normalize options and also improves type safety or at least it unifies the logic into a common method.

We can now enabled/disabled optimisations for scripts and styles.

Ex: 
```
 optimization: {
   scripts: true,
   styles: false,
 },
```

Following a suggestion from @filipesilva, I combined these 2 PRs togather.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Enable fine grain optimization settings" (#13120)

- `ng build --prod --noAot --noBuildOptimizer`


### The log given by the failure
At the moment, when AOT is disabled components styles are not being optimised. Ie, cleancss is not running.

So for instance the above code, it should have been minified to `p {color: #fff}`. But this is only happening when using the AOT compiler.

### Desired functionality
Component styles should be minified both when using the JIT and AOT Compiler.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Component CSS don't get optimized unless AOT is enabled" (#13119)

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config
Issues.Body:
- When using Universal sourceMaps should not be enabled or at least `styles` sourceMaps should be disabled as these will otherwise be inlined and will be set as apart of the server side rendered page.

- While there is no benefit to optimize the scripts at server level, styles should always be minified so that the server side rendered page is smaller.

Fixes #12541 and Fixes #12940

Depends on https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/13116
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@schematics/angular): set `optimization` and `sourceMap` in universal production config" (#13117)

Issues.Title: No outlines for checkbox, radio buttons when using TalkBack
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using Android TalkBack, the system highlights interactive elements with a green border when they are focused. On some components, such as mat-select, are highlighted as expected. However, mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button seem to be suppressing the highlighting.
It may be due to "-webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent", introduced in https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/11349.

#### What is the expected behavior?
mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button should be highlighted when they are focused by the screen reader.

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-checkbox and mat-radio-button are not highlighted when they are focused by the screen reader.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Go to https://material.angular.io/components/checkbox/overview on an Android phone with TalkBack enabled. Swipe horizontally until the attention is focused on the checkbox. You will see hear that that checkbox is focused and can be interacted with, but it is not highlighted on the screen.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No outlines for checkbox, radio buttons when using TalkBack" (#14385)

Adds a new injection token to allow people to configure the default options for the expansion panel component.

Fixes #14383.

Issues.Title: Feature request: Default option values for Expansion Panel Header collapsed/expanded heights
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Possibility to control globally the `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` properties of an Expansion Panel Header.

#### What is the expected behavior?
Similarly to what is currently available for form fields (via `MAT_FORM_FIELD_DEFAULT_OPTIONS`), if the `mat-expansion-panel-header`  `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` properties are available for a global definition (default options), they should be considered for any Expansion Panel Header on the application.
If an Expansion Panel Header explicitly defines any of these properties, then the default values should be overriden.

#### What is the current behavior?
Not available as of now. Each `mat-expansion-panel-header` needs to explicitly declare these properties.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
N/A

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
When the Angular Material default values for `collapsedHeight` and `expandedHeight` don't meet the application needs, there should be a way to redefine them, reuse them, and consider their values from a global perspective.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Any.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
N/A
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: Default option values for Expansion Panel Header collapsed/expanded heights" (#14383)

Issues.Title: Feature Request: matFormField appearance="fill" has no way to control the background color.
Issues.Body:
I am enjoying the new additions to mat-form-field but I am unable to use them in my project because the background color of the input is too hard to select. I've tried all manner of css selectors and between inline styling, I have yet to find a way to change the background-color or any documentation stating how the theme it. I am aware that input allows for the underline, and the label, but in this case, there is no way to change the fillColor. I propose maybe something like 

```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill>
<input matInput name="name" fillColor="accent"> 
</mat-form-field>
```

or
```
<mat-form-field appearance="fill" fillColor="accent">
<input matInput name="name>
</mat-form-field>
```

This change will greatly improve the versatility of matInput, and allow for matInput to be used in a variety of applications!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature Request: matFormField appearance="fill" has no way to control the background color." (#14381)

Issues.Title: Snackbar and dialog taking full screen in production
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
I use MatDialog and MatSnackBar at various points in my web app to notify/ warn user about something. When I use these in debug mode using `ng serve` the size and position of snackbar is correct like snackbar is at the bottom of the page with height approximately 50-60px and dialog is at center of page with height enough to wrap the content. Now the problem what is occuring is when I am using `ng build --prod --build-optimizer` and uploading files to firebase hosting these same dialogs and snackbars are taking full height and full width.

#### What is the expected behavior?
The dialogs and snackbars should show normal behaviour in production mode

#### What is the current behavior?
Dialogs and snackbars cover whole screen in production mode

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Nice UI for the user

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
```
  "@angular/animations": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/cdk": "^7.0.2",
    "@angular/common": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/compiler": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/core": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/fire": "^5.1.0",
    "@angular/forms": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/http": "^7.0.1",
    "@angular/material": "^7.0.2",
```

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Images in production

![2018-12-04 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28218177/49407894-32812880-f780-11e8-9aa1-6b734afe9fdb.png)


Images in debug mode
![2018-12-04 3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28218177/49407864-2006ef00-f780-11e8-97bc-0e24f5fb1d0b.png)

Issues.Title: Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Today I went with a beginner in Angular over adding Material Design and she started running the installation manually as she read in the [getting started](https://material.angular.io/guide/getting-started) guide. I think it makes most sense to have the first step in Getting Started being the `ng add` option. #### What is the expected behavior? Developers should be advised to use `ng add @angular/material`. #### What is the current behavior? Developers are currently advised to manually install the dependencies, then the snapshots, and after that the `ng add` option. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.
StackBlitz starter: https://goo.gl/wwnhMV
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? It should be as easy as possible for people starting with Angular to add Angular Material. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know? I would love to make the changes to the docs if the maintainers agree it should be addressed. Basically creating this issue to spark a conversation around it, if you agree I'll submit a PR üëç
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Material Getting Started should mention ng add as primary installation option" (#14380)

Issues.Title: Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay
Issues.Body: The datepicker presents itself as a modal dialog. On mobile devices, scree-reader users don't have an escape button to press and obviously would have a hard time tapping on the backdrop. We can add a close button with `cdk-visually-hidden` to help work around this. The label for this would also have to be added to `MatDatepickerIntl`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add (invisible) close button to datepicker overlay" (#14379)

Issues.Title: Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource
Issues.Body:
I see too frequently people misunderstand the intent behind `MatTableDataSource`, thinking that it's meant to be the primary (or only) way to add data to the table. Renaming this, and more eminently presenting it in the docs as just one option would hopefully help clear this up. 

Obviously this will need to be done in a backwards compatible way. It will also need a migration schematic.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Rename MatTableDataSource to ClientArrayTableDataSource" (#14378)

Issues.Title: MatDialog scroll entire dialog
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: feature request #### What is the expected behavior? An ability to scroll the entire dialog and not just the content. Meaning - the dialog should have the full height of its content and scrolling will happen "outside" the dialog. The dialog would expand beyond the boundaries of the view. #### What is the current behavior? Scrolling can only happen inside the dialog. This creates a confusing UX where users don't have an indication that there is more content under scroll. #### What are the steps to reproduce? Providing a StackBlitz reproduction is the *best* way to share your issue.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior? #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? #### Is there anything else we should know?

Issues.Title: table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug: `table[mat-table]` makes testing hard because it doesn't have a way for getting `debugElement`s to be queried.

#### What is the expected behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` should find directives inside a mat-table

#### What is the current behavior?
`fixture.debugElement.query(By.css('*'))` only finds `table[mat-table]` as a DebugElement but it can't find any other debug element that's a child of the table

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-testing-template-4n6yno
This has 2 describes: 1 with `table[mat-table]` (normal table) and another with `mat-table` (flex tables)

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Testing is hard otherwise, my work around has been overriding the module, remove the directive, make a fake directive that has `@HostBinding('click') click() { capturedInstance = this; }` and test with that.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
6.0.0

#### Is there anything else we should know?
As implicitly mentioned above, `<mat-table>` works OK, the problem seems to be on how `<table mat-table>` renders the rows which seems to be with `createEmbeddedView`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "table[mat-table] doesn't allow debugElement.query to find directives inside it" (#14375)

Issues.Title: Add ability to lazy render content for specific panel in case of nested expansion panels
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Feature request

#### What is the expected behavior?
Only expansion panel that contains template with `matExpansionPanelContent` directive should lazy render it in case of a nested expansion panels.

#### What is the current behavior?
All parent expansion panels render `matExpansionPanelContent` template of child panel if they don't contain any specific template for themself.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
StackBlitz reproduction: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-fa7h1c


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
There is a case where I have to use nested expansion panels with lazy rendering for different content blocks in the child expansion panels. If I want to render content properly, then I also have to make all parent expansion panels content lazy rendered.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 6.1.1
Material 6.4.2
TypeScript 2.9.2

#### Is there anything else we should know?
This issue can be also reproduced on the latest versions of Angular and Material
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add ability to lazy render content for specific panel in case of nested expansion panels" (#14365)

Issues.Title: MatProgressBar and conditional rendering
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
Bug

#### What is the expected behavior?
I expect the progress bar to work as expected even with an if condition:
```
<mat-progress-bar
   *ngIf="(fileUploadPercent$ | async) > 0"
   mode="determinate"
   value="{{ fileUploadPercent$ | async }}"
></mat-progress-bar>
```

#### What is the current behavior?
It shows 0 progress even though the value of `fileUploadPercent$` goes to 100.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatProgressBar and conditional rendering" (#14357)

Issues.Title: chore: improve type safety in breakpoint observer
Issues.Body:
Fixes a workaround where we cast the MediaQueryList event listener to any because TypeScript didn't have proper types before TS 3.1. 

There is still asignature issue with our current TypeScript version, but at least we can now type all other declarations, and just have a wrong signature for `removeListener`. This has been fixed with https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/commit/40bd7c89abbdf79493e2ea20dd80d9eb657dc82e and can be used with v3.2.1 (once we upgrade in the future)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "chore: improve type safety in breakpoint observer" (#14356)
